text: Trade-offs : Hi-fi vs. Lo-fi Prototypes Lo-fi: Cheap (easy to get started, quick to try many iterations) Lack of detail (invites the user to fill in details) Not realistic Low level of validity when testing Hi-fi: Expensive Realistic High level of validity when testing (ecological validity?) Testing is done at a later stage Premature commitment Clients believe they are real! Reluctance in making radical changes (designer/user)
